roleset.name: to wake or make aware again

example.name: with Arg2
example.text: Appropriations committees have used an assortment of devices to disguise as much as $ 1 billion in spending , and as critics have reawakened to these devices , the bill can seem like a wounded caribou trying to make it past ice and wolves to reach safer winter grazing .

example.name: nominal
example.text: The short - term shift in the political climate surrounding abortion reflects two factors that are likely to govern the debate in the next several months : the reawakening of the abortion - rights movement as a potent force after years of lassitude , and the ability of each side to counter the other 's advance in one arena with a victory of its own elsewhere .

propbank.arg: of the abortion - rights movement as a potent force

roleset.note: REAWAKEN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'reawaken' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from reawaken.01-v predicate notes)
